title: At least 1 dead in shooting at Washington grocery store
description: The Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives confirms to CNN they received a call for assistance for an active shooter situation at a Fred Meyer grocery store in Richland, Washington.

title: Cut nearly 300 calories a day by doing something you already do
description: Want to lose weight from sleeping? Try extending your sleep time so you are not sleep deprived.

title: Watch Scholz's interview with CNN's Jake Tapper
description: CNN's Jake Tapper presses German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on why he will not explicitly say that if Russia invades Ukraine, the Nord Stream 2 pipeline is dead.

title: After more than 1,000 years, this English pub is closing its doors
description: An English pub that claims to be the oldest in Britain is closing due to financial problems worsened by the pandemic.

title: German leader declines to back Biden's vow to shut down Nord Stream 2 if Russia invades Ukraine
CDC's highest travel risk level is jam-packed with nearly 135 places, including Japan
description: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention added even more destinations on Monday to its ever-growing list of places considered to be a "very high" travel risk for Covid-19.

title: Tesla got a subpoena from US government 10 days after Elon Musk's Twitter poll
description: Tesla said on Monday it received a subpoena from the U.S. securities regulator related to a settlement that required Chief Executive Elon Musk's tweets on material information about the company to be vetted.

title: Some of world's biggest companies failing on their own climate pledges, researchers say
description: Amazon, Google, Ikea and BMW are among some of the world's biggest companies failing to meet their own proclaimed climate targets and align with international agreements to slash greenhouse gas emissions, a new report claims.

title: Boy sneaked a book he wrote on a library shelf. More than 100 people want to check it out
description: An imaginative boy who loves comic books now has a graphic novel of his own on the shelves of his local library.

title: Every Republican should read this Lisa Murkowski quote
Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis signals support for 'Don't Say Gay' bill
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis appeared Monday to voice support for a controversial state bill that would ban certain discussions about sexual orientation and gender identity in the classroom.

title: Ford suspends some production because of chip shortage
description: Ford shares were down about 1% in trading Monday after the company announced it is suspending or slowing production at several of its North American factories this week due to short supplies of computer chips.

title: New spinal cord stimulation study puts people with paralysis on their feet again
description: Michel Roccati lost the ability to walk after a motorcycle accident in 2017, when he had a complete spinal cord injury. But today, equipped with an electrode device implanted on his spinal cord, Roccati can enjoy the simple things again: standing at a bar for drinks with friends, taking a shower without a chair and even strolling through the town with a walker.

title: 15-year-old figure skater lands history-making move at Olympics
Golfer sinks 92-foot eagle putt for dramatic win
description: A finish to a golf tournament doesn't get more dramatic than Sunday's Saudi International.

title: Spirit and Frontier Airlines plan to merge
description: Spirit and Frontier Airlines on Monday announced a $6.6 billion merger, a combination of low-fare carriers that would create America's fifth-largest airline.

title: Razzie nominations 2022: 'Diana the Musical,' Jared Leto and Bruce Willis make the list
description: The best of the worst of 2021 cinema has been announced.

title: \Father's farewell to Moroccan boy who died after days trapped in well
description: Crowds gathered in Morocco's northern Chefchaouen province on Monday to attend the funeral of five-year-old Rayan Aourram, who died after being trapped in a well for four days.

title: Tesla still owns $2 billion in bitcoin, but crypto volatility has taken a toll
description: If you've been hurt by the volatile moves in bitcoin lately, you're in good company. Tesla, run by the world's richest person, Elon Musk, has been hit by the crypto craziness too.

title: He rides his bike, has solar panels, and eats veggies. But this one decision makes his carbon footprint worse
description: Johan Verink from Davis, California, wanted to know how he can reduce his carbon footprint so he called CNN to ask how his personal decisions are impacting the planet. See the surprising answer.

title: PriceRunner sues Google for 2.1 billion euros, prepares for long fight
description: Swedish price comparison firm PriceRunner said on Monday it was suing Alphabet-owned Google for about 2.1 billion euros ($2.4 billion), the latest firm to take legal action alleging the search giant manipulated search results.

title: Jordan Spieth says he's glad he 'didn't fall off' cliff after hitting 'life and death' shot
description: Jordan Spieth's knack of salvaging an errant shot has become a trademark of his game.

title: Donald Trump quietly making millions from coffee table book
description: A few months ago, former President Donald Trump signed a book deal.

title: These two countries are responsible for 'junkyard' in Earth's orbit
description: Earth's orbit has been collecting debris and now the White House is looking for new technology to clean it up. CNN's space and defense correspondent Kristin Fisher reports.

title: 15-year-old figure skater lands history-making move
description:
• China's rising star is also undeniably American
• Live updates: Day 4 of the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympics

title: Images show latest US military aid to arrive in Ukraine
description: An 80-ton-shipment of military aid from the US has arrived in Ukraine, according to the US embassy in Kyiv, Ukraine. This latest delivery is the eighth in recent days, as tensions between Ukraine and Russia have been rising. CNN's Melissa Bell reports from Kyiv.

title: One of the world's most popular countries is reopening its doors this month
description: Australia will open its borders to fully vaccinated international travelers from late February, Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison announced on Monday, February 7 after a meeting of the government's national security committee.

title: Director quits Ajax after sending inappropriate messages to female colleagues
description: Marc Overmars will leave his position as Ajax's Director of Football Affairs after sending inappropriate messages to female colleagues, the Dutch football club announced on Sunday.

title: Australian PM tells tourism industry to 'get ready' as country set to open borders
description: Australia will open its borders to fully vaccinated international travelers in late February, Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison announced after a meeting of the government's national security committee. CNN's Ivan Watson reports.

title: Hear details of rare Peng Shuai interview with Western media
description: Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai has reemerged at the Beijing Olympics, meeting with the president of the International Olympic Committee and giving a rare interview with the French sports news site L'Equipe. CNN's Selina Wang has more.

title: Pregnant women are less likely to impact their children's weight than previously believed
description: A pregnant woman's body mass index has less of an influence on her child's BMI than previously believed, according to a new study. BMI is a measure that uses height and weight data to track changes in weight.

title: Dramatic photos cast Europe's ancient castles in a new light
description: For centuries, medieval castles -- hulking, isolated triumphs of masonry -- have held a special place in the Western imagination, evoking at once a sense of history, fantasy, war and romance. They are the perennial backdrops for period dramas and children's books, travel brochures and fashion spreads.

title: Video shows entire village washed away by cyclone
description: Madagascar has suffered from two storms in two weeks. The island nation is trying to recover from a second powerful storm striking and causing serious damage. CNN's Michael Holmes reports.

title: 'Fight Club' ending restored in China after cries of censorship
description: "Fight Club" is almost back to its original state in China.

title: China's rising star is also undeniably American
description: At this year's Beijing Winter Olympics, the face of China's sporting dreams is undeniably American.

title: How some Brits are reacting to Queen's announcement about Camilla
description: Britain's Queen Elizabeth II has called for the Duchess of Cornwall to be known as Queen Camilla when Charles becomes King in her Platinum Jubilee message. CNN's Max Foster reports.

title: Former CNN Digital Asia Director Marc Lourdes dies at 40
description: Marc Lourdes, a former director of CNN Digital Worldwide for Asia-Pacific, died tragically in a motorcycle accident in Malaysia on Saturday. He was 40.

title: Eileen Gu makes Games debut in front of cheering home crowd
Billie Eilish stops Atlanta concert to help fan get an inhaler
description: Billie Eilish had a moment during her Atlanta concert Saturday night that has gone viral for all the right reasons.

title: Navy SEAL candidate dies after 'Hell Week'
description: A Navy SEAL candidate died Friday and another was hospitalized in San Diego after completing a training phase known as "Hell Week."

title: Kylie Jenner and Travis Scott welcome their second child
description: Kylie Jenner and Travis Scott have a new baby.
